articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Parking fees expand to 22 more Oregon state parks starting March 30, 2026. Daily permits are $10 for Oregon residents and $12 for out-of-state visitors, with annual options available. Fees support upkeep for day-use amenities like restrooms, trails, and boat ramps.
articles.title: Parking Permits Expand To 22 More Oregon State Parks Starting March 30

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: RPD cited multiple people for trespass and prohibited camping, including camps on posted ODOT property and a no-camping park area. Arrests included criminal mischief after a rock-through-windshield incident, two theft cases, a warrant arrest, and a DUII-related call.
articles.title: Police Log: February 24, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg will celebrate its new $2.5 million outdoor tennis and pickleball facility with a ribbon cutting at 3:30 p.m. Thursday, March 5, at Stewart Park. The upgrade includes eight tennis courts, 10 pickleball courts, plus new lighting, fencing, seating, and security.
articles.title: Ribbon Cutting Set For Roseburg’s New $2.5 Million Outdoor Tennis And Pickleball Facility

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Ingram Content Group announced Covered, a new site launching fall 2026 where publishers can share catalogs and digital review copies. The platform will offer title details and marketing assets, plus a galley program for booksellers and librarians, with broader rollout in 2027.
articles.title: Ingram Content Group Announces "Covered" Platform To Streamline Catalog Sharing And Review Copies

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Sherm’s Thunderbird Markets confirmed plans to sell its four Southern Oregon grocery stores and a Medford warehouse as part of a succession plan. Leadership said the goal is to find a buyer who will keep stores operating as they have for years, and that it’s “business as usual” for now.
articles.title: Sherm’s Thunderbird Markets, Inc. Family Confirms Plan to Sell Four Stores and Medford Warehouse

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: An Oregon State Police traffic stop on northbound I-5 near milepost 168 by Cottage Grove just before 11 a.m. Feb. 21 led to the seizure of 40.5 pounds of meth, found in 40 resealable bags inside a duffel bag in the trunk, police said.
articles.title: Traffic Stop Near Cottage Grove Ends With 40.5 Pounds of Meth Seized

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg police arrested a 25-year-old man after a reported disturbance at the Idle Hour late Feb. 20. Officers said the victim had red marks on her neck and her Volkswagen Beetle was damaged. He was lodged at corrections on harassment and criminal mischief charges.
articles.title: Man Grabbed Woman by the Neck Outside Idle Hour, Arrest Made

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Diamond Lake’s tubing hill will be closed this weekend after rain since Sunday created ponds at the bottom of the hill. Operators say it will take a significant snow event to reopen, and updates will be posted on their page.
articles.title: Diamond Lake Tubing Hill Closes for the Weekend After Rain

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg High School Foundation will host Scholarship Night and Future First Citizen on Thursday, March 12, 2026, at RHS. Social hour starts at 5:30 p.m., followed by a 6:30 p.m. recognition program in the Rose Theater and a reception.
articles.title: Roseburg High School Foundation Sets March 12 Celebration for Scholarships, Future First Citizen

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Police reported multiple incidents including trespass and parole detainers, prohibited camping and littering enforcement, a nitrous oxide inhalants citation under the Oak Street Bridge, and felony sex-abuse charges tied to a separate investigation.
articles.title: Police Log: February 23, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: February 24, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Flood Watch is in effect for central Douglas County and surrounding areas from Monday evening through Wednesday evening. Heavy rain and rising snow levels may cause rapid runoff, leading to possible flooding of creeks, streams and low-lying areas. Residents should monitor forecasts.
articles.title: Flood Watch Issued For Douglas County And Surrounding Areas Through Wednesday Evening

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Winston Police K9 Nike will retire March 1 after more than eight years of service, including 110 deployments and 65 captures. The Belgian Malinois will live with his handler and serve as an ambassador for local K9 programs. A community retirement event is planned March 6 in Winston.
articles.title: Winston Police K9 Nike Set To Retire After More Than 8 Years Of Service

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Multiple traffic crashes were reported along with several warrant and parole-violation arrests, multiple DUII cases including a reported hit-and-run, a harassment/criminal mischief arrest, a trespass arrest and several prohibited-camping citations, according to the latest Roseburg police logs.
articles.title: Police Log: February 20 - February 23, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Work resumes Feb. 23 on a Roseburg water main upgrade along SE Pine Street between Oak and Sykes. Crews will replace aging pipe, install hydrants and update service lines. One lane will be closed during weekday work hours, with construction expected to continue into early summer.
articles.title: Roseburg Water Main Project On SE Pine Street To Resume Feb. 23

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: UCAN’s Cheese & Thank You campaign returns this March, with local restaurants across Douglas County donating $2 from featured cheesy menu items to the UCAN Food Bank. A kickoff event with free grilled cheese is set for Feb. 28 in Roseburg to launch the month-long fundraiser.
articles.title: Cheese & Thank You Campaign Returns to Douglas County, Serving Up Comfort Food for a Cause

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: February 23, 2026

articles.author: Rachel McConaghie
articles.description: The criminal case involving injuries to two special needs students at Fremont Middle School, allegedly caused by instructional assistants, has been dropped, but parents remain concerned about transparency and are considering civil legal action against the Roseburg School District.
articles.title: Fremont Middle School in spotlight over student injury claims
